seniority_level.evidence: Minimum of 3 years of experience mentioned, which aligns with mid-level expectations for a Data Engineer role. No explicit senior-level title or responsibilities.

job_family.evidence: Title explicitly mentions 'Data Engineer-Business Intelligence' and responsibilities focus on reporting, visualization, and BI/DW projects.

sub_specialty.evidence: Core focus on BI/DW projects, reporting, and visualization using Cognos, along with ETL/Data Integration tools.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Responsibilities include development, testing, and support of reports, but no explicit mention of technical leadership or people management.

primary_cloud.evidence: Cloud platforms (AWS, Google, Azure) are listed as nice-to-have, but no explicit primary cloud focus is stated.

secondary_clouds.evidence: Nice-to-have skills include AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure, suggesting exposure to multiple clouds is preferred but not required.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Focus on BI/DW projects and ETL/Data Integration tools (IBM InfoSphere DataStage, Azure Data Factory, Informatica PowerCenter) implies batch processing. No explicit streaming tools mentioned.

orchestrator_category.evidence: No explicit mention of orchestration tools like Airflow, Luigi, or cloud-native orchestrators.

storage_layer.evidence: BI/DW projects and reporting/visualization focus suggest a data warehouse storage layer (e.g., Cognos). No lakehouse or mixed patterns explicitly mentioned.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location is specified as Pune, Maharashtra, India, implying a regional restriction for on-site or hybrid work.

timezone_focus.evidence: Location is restricted to India (Pune), suggesting a focus on the APAC timezone or India-specific work hours.

relocation_required.evidence: No mention of relocation assistance or requirements. Location is specified as Pune, implying the candidate must already be based there or in the region.

h1b_friendly.evidence: Visa sponsorship is not mentioned, and the role is based in India with no signals for H1B support.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No explicit mention of OPT/CPT or student visa support. Location and experience requirements suggest work authorization in India is needed.

citizenship_required.evidence: No discussion of citizenship or work authorization requirements beyond the location being India.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Employment type is full-time, but no explicit contract type (W2, C2C, 1099) is mentioned.

benefits_level.evidence: No benefits are explicitly mentioned in the job posting or Pass 1 extraction.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'continuous improvement' and 'growth opportunities' but lacks specificity on career tracks or promotion ladders.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions developing relationships with 'business and technical members of the team', suggesting collaboration with senior team members.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotion or advancement paths.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No discussion of internal mobility or lateral moves.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No explicit or implied career tracks mentioned (e.g., IC, management, specialist).

requirement_strictness.evidence: Job posting uses strict language like 'should have a minimum of 3 years' and 'required' for education and skills, with clear must-have hard skills listed.

scope_definition.evidence: Responsibilities are well-defined around BI/DW projects, reporting, and visualization, with a focus on Cognos development and administration.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Requirements align reasonably with a mid-level role (3 years of experience, full-time education in MCA/M.Tech/B.Tech/B.E). No unrealistic skill combinations detected.
